TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IAccessor

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")

summary.span: Provides an implementation of the OLE DB interface for use by applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

span.span: Provides an implementation of the OLE DB interface for use by applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > Les fonctions et objets de l’espace de noms sont fournis pour être utilisés par les outils de mise à niveau de Visual Basic 6.0 vers Visual Basic.Functions and objects in the namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. Dans la plupart des cas, ces fonctions et objets dupliquent les fonctionnalités que vous pouvez trouver dans d’autres espaces de noms dans le [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. Ils sont nécessaires uniquement lorsque le modèle de code Visual Basic 6.0 diffère significativement de le [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implémentation.They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddRefAccessor (int hAccessor, out int cRefCount);
.method public newslot virtual instance void AddRefAccessor([in]int32 hAccessor, [out] int32& cRefCount) cil managed
Public Sub AddRefAccessor (hAccessor As Integer, ByRef cRefCount As Integer)
public: void AddRefAccessor(int hAccessor, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] int % cRefCount);
abstract member AddRefAccessor : int * -> unit

param.name: hAccessor
param.span: The handle of the accessor for which to increment the reference count.

span.span: The handle of the accessor for which to increment the reference count.

param.name: cRefCount
param.span: A pointer to memory in which to return the reference count of the accessor handle.

span.span: A pointer to memory in which to return the reference count of the accessor handle.

param.span: If cRefCount is a null pointer, no reference count is returned.

span.span: If cRefCount is a null pointer, no reference count is returned.

summary.span: Adds a reference count to an existing accessor.

span.span: Adds a reference count to an existing accessor.
